result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew L Walters #277519 Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (>$500 - $5000)], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: From DA Kohlwey requesting JOC be amended: probation be consecutive to present sentence.
Two restitution stipulations filed. One from 14CM100, which was read in and dismissed.
Filed by Atty Leonie Dolch

Cases heard: 14CF396 & 14CM100, Defendant Matthew L Walters in court, in custody with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to counts 1&2 in 14CF396. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Court imposed 3 yrs. prison consisting of 2 yr. confinement and 1 yr. extended supervision, stayed that sentence, placed defendant on 3 yr. probation, consecutive to any sentences serving.  On ct. 2, sentence withheld, 1 yr. probation, concurrent with ct. 1. Conditions: restitution in stipulations,  complete AODA and follow all treatment recommendations, comply with random UAs, no use/possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no possession of paraphernalia, maintain full-time work, schooling, or treatment. Submit DNA sample, $528 costs on ct. 1, $443 costs on ct. 2 No jail credit. Remaining counts in 14CF396 & 14CM100 read in and dismissed.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus to Dodge Correctional Institution for 3/16/15 at 11:30 am.
